hypothesis_content.title: L1 Token Pairs (SOL/AVAX) Stress Regime Flight-to-Liquidity
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes (sharp market declines >15% in 3 days), the SOL/AVAX price ratio will move in favor of the more liquid asset (SOL) as investors flee to liquidity, creating a pairs opportunity that reverts within 5 days as panic subsides.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During market stress, liquidity becomes paramount. SOL's deeper markets attract flight-to-liquidity flows versus AVAX, creating temporary dislocation. This typically reverts as panic subsides and relative valuation matters again. The volume ratio confirms liquidity preference.
entry_conditions: SOL/AVAX ratio moves > 3% in 1 day favoring SOL

exit_conditions.take_profit: Ratio mean reversion of 50% of the initial stress move
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 days or regime change from STRESS

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Ratio dislocation persists beyond 5 days in >50% of stress events, or AVAX consistently outperforms SOL during stress periods.
